title: Strictly pro Kevin messes up routine after being given 45 minutes to replace Neil
text:

Strictly Come Dancing professional Kevin Clifton was drafted in at the last-minute to replace injured Neil Jones tonight.

With Neil ruled out by a late injury during rehearsals, Kevin stepped in to dance with former footballer Alex Scott.

Alex was forced to teach the entire street commercial routine to Kevin before their couples' choice dance.

The football pundit set the dance floor alight and received high praise form the judges, who noticed that Kev did make a few mistakes.

Praising Alex after the performance, Kevin said: "Then having to teach a to do the dance in 45 minutes. Everyone can probably see I got a few things wrong in that and Alex kept the whole thing going on her own."

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

The pair received a high score of 34 from the judges, who praised Alex for dealing with adversity.

Speaking to Claudia Winkleman, she said: "My partner, Neil, I feel bad. We did what we did. The show must go on. You can take it one way or the other. Thank you to Kev."

Kevin admitted: "I literally went out and blanked in the middle of the routine and got it all wrong. You carried me through, Alex."

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

Giving his feedback, Craig Revel Horwood said Alex did "very well" and the style suited her contact body.

Motsi Mabuse said: "Alex, I have to give it to you. I heard you say to Kevin jumps and this and that. Changing a professional partner. That really honestly was a great performance from you. It's double from what we had at the beginning."

Shirley Ballas claimed she did not want to talk about the actual dancing.

She said: "To switch partners an hour before the show., come out here, not panic when he made a mistake. I thought it was absolutely on point, congratulations."

Bruno Tonilloi added: "Talk bout delivering under pressure. This was your best dance ever."

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

Strictly viewers took to Twitter after the performance to praise Alex and Kevin for their routine.

One fan said: "Alex and Kevin were amazing she looked like the professional. Well done alex!"

"Fabulous credit to Kevin for stepping in 45 mins before the show started! Fantastic Ghostbusters Halloween dance routine Alex Scott & Kevin Clifton, "added another.

A third said: "Alex danced so well this week with Kevin when they only had about 45 minutes rehearsals together!"

"Fair play to Alex tonight though. And Kevin also for stepping in last minute. Can’t have been easy and they still did so well. Thought the score was justified, as sometimes it’s not just about the dancing," said a fourth.

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

Neil wasn't the only casualty of the night, as Will Bayley was injured in a horror fall and also had to pull out of the Halloween special.

Strictly announced: “Sadly, Will Bayley was injured during training and medics have said he cannot dance in the show this weekend.

"Under the rules of Strictly Come Dancing , Will has been granted a bye to next week.

"Separately, Alex Scott’s partner Neil Jones received an injury whilst training this morning. Kevin Clifton has stepped in to partner Alex in tonight’s show."

*Strictly Come Dancing airs tonight on BBC One at 6.35pm
description: Kevin Clifton stepped in for injured Neil Jones at the last-minute - and it was Alex Scott that corrected him during their routine
